author: anthonypants
body:
## Steps to reproduce

Copy the following:
```powershell
Get-Process		# This is a test.
```
Paste it into a `pwsh` window.

## Expected behavior

The following is displayed (or at least some other non-tab whitespace insertion):
```none
Get-Process		# This is a test.
```

## Actual behavior

The following is displayed:
```none
Get-ProcessMitigation# This is a test.
```

## Environment data

This is reproducible from within a `pwsh.exe` window, Windows Terminal, or the embedded VS Code terminal.
```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
I think this is a duplicate of #15151 - see https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/15151#issuecomment-812926200 for an explanation. 

<kbd>Ctrl-V</kbd> avoids the problem in regular console windows and Windows Terminal windows, thanks to `PSReadLine`, but seemingly not in Visual Studio Code, on all supported platforms.

The problem comes down to many environments implementing pasting _as simulated typing_.

In terminals on Unix-like platforms, the behavior depends on the specific terminal application.

The only terminal that I know of that offers support is iTerm2.app on macOS, which can be configured to convert tabs to spaces on pasting.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as duplicate and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Pasting text containing tabs into pwsh terminal attempts tab completion
